poem:
### Across the Atlantic  

I love America!  
cries the Yorkshireman,  
a soft echo of belief,  
amid a clamor of danger—  
A vision obscured,  
yet still flickers  
like the stars,  
hidden by storm's veil,  
but faithful to shine again,  
lighting paths unknown,  
where hope  
demands belief.
